attributes.action: cut fuel duty so petrol and diesel will cost 80p per litre.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The cost of food and goods has risen with fuel prices over the past year and has helped increase the rate of inflation to twice the governments target. VAT should no longer be charged on fuel duty and fuel duty should be cut so it can help ease the inflationary pressure, hopefully enabling the Bank of England to cut interest rates and reduce the strain on people with low income.
